subject: apache2: log true client IP addresses
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-08-06 00:34:34.000000000', 'message': 'apache2: log true client IP addresses

In the current topology, the horizon app is served behind a haproxt app
acting as a L4 load balancer/proxy. This leads to apache access logs
having the IP addresses of the proxies as client IPs which does not
represent the truth.

This patch is an attempt to mitigate this issue by enabling the proxy
protocol in the communication between apache and haproxy apps for a
more accurate representation of the access logs.

More information can be found in the official apache docs:
https://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/mod/mod_remoteip.html

Closes-Bug: #1829796
Change-Id: I09b9a869489d0d16a2eee19fd579b0f9c52559cb
Signed-off-by: Mert Kırpıcı <mert.kirpici@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
apache2: log true client IP addresses

In the current topology, the horizon app is served behind a haproxt app
acting as a L4 load balancer/proxy. This leads to apache access logs
having the IP addresses of the proxies as client IPs which does not
represent the truth.

This patch is an attempt to mitigate this issue by enabling the proxy
protocol in the communication between apache and haproxy apps for a
more accurate representation of the access logs.

More information can be found in the official apache docs:
https://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/mod/mod_remoteip.html

Closes-Bug: #1829796
Change-Id: I09b9a869489d0d16a2eee19fd579b0f9c52559cb
Signed-off-by: Mert Kırpıcı <mert.kirpici@canonical.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-29 13:59:40.000000000', 'message': "Port update will trigger less notifications to the DHCP agents

After port update, DHCP agent will be notified about changes only if
one of the port's attributes related somehow to the DHCP will change.
Such fields are:
* fixed_ips,
* MAC address,
* dns_domain,
* dns_name,
* dns_assignment,
* extra_dhcp_opts.

In other cases there is no reason to send notifications to the agent.
This will results with less notifications to the DHCP agent and less
possibilities to race condition between DHCP and L2 agents while
switching ports from the DOWN to ACTIVE status and sending notifications
to nova.

Closes-Bug: #1982367
Change-Id: If7990bdec435af76ad2e88fd4ea2bc24a255fd5a
(cherry picked from commit 06ddcaf4368ce054a8d396e70880f7dd1abe0562)
"}]
commit_message:
Port update will trigger less notifications to the DHCP agents

After port update, DHCP agent will be notified about changes only if
one of the port's attributes related somehow to the DHCP will change.
Such fields are:
* fixed_ips,
* MAC address,
* dns_domain,
* dns_name,
* dns_assignment,
* extra_dhcp_opts.

In other cases there is no reason to send notifications to the agent.
This will results with less notifications to the DHCP agent and less
possibilities to race condition between DHCP and L2 agents while
switching ports from the DOWN to ACTIVE status and sending notifications
to nova.

Closes-Bug: #1982367
Change-Id: If7990bdec435af76ad2e88fd4ea2bc24a255fd5a
(cherry picked from commit 06ddcaf4368ce054a8d396e70880f7dd1abe0562)

commit_message:
Remove redundant override of logging_context_format_string

The target value is exactly same as the default defined in oslo.log,
thus this override is just redundant.

Change-Id: Ib386df2d8abf561c5b1c266f4c64d544e93c5d62

commit_message:
Fujitsu Driver: Add manage related support

Added supported for manage related function in Fujitsu driver

Added support for the following functions:
* get manageable volume
* get manageable snapshot
* manage volume
* manage snapshot

Change-Id: I03575e97f9e57685480b62d8b14060262428c8ff

commit_message:
Deal with broken links

Fix broken links.

A paragraph involving a Juju link needed to be reworded
due to the destination page being removed from circulation.
A link may be put back if, and when, this gets resolved.
The subject concerns Juju application groups.

Change-Id: I303ebd262e31a501181727e9c69e04834c3c4d8d

upper-constraints.

messages: [{'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2022-07-22 12:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2022-07-22 14:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-07-25 06:10:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2022-08-05 16:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-22 12:52:14.000000000', 'message': "Removing Popen object return from utils.run_command_and_log

Argument 'retcode_only' of the function and associated logic was removed
as it was not beneficial to the purpose, or use of the function.

Before this patch, only call of the function setting 'retcode_only'
to 'True' was made in tests of the tripleoclient. All other calls
worked with assumption that Bool, not object will be returned,
and didn't supply the argument explicitly. Instead relying on
the default value.

In addition, it is not clear how would the Popen[0] object be
used, if it was returned.

The function has limited impact across Openstack[1],
only calls to it are made within tripleoclient, although there is
a homonymous function withing validations_libs[2] intended
for a same task.

Docstring and tests were adjusted accordingly. Minor docstring typo was fixed.

[0]https://docs.python.org/3/library/subprocess.html#popen-objects
[1]https://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=run_command_and_log&i=nope&literal=nope&files=&excludeFiles=&repos=
[2]https://opendev.org/openstack/validations-libs/src/branch/master/validations_libs/utils.py#L607

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie735ed470966a976940aefc8f99b106699080a83
"}]
commit_message:
Removing Popen object return from utils.run_command_and_log

Argument 'retcode_only' of the function and associated logic was removed
as it was not beneficial to the purpose, or use of the function.

Before this patch, only call of the function setting 'retcode_only'
to 'True' was made in tests of the tripleoclient. All other calls
worked with assumption that Bool, not object will be returned,
and didn't supply the argument explicitly. Instead relying on
the default value.

In addition, it is not clear how would the Popen[0] object be
used, if it was returned.

The function has limited impact across Openstack[1],
only calls to it are made within tripleoclient, although there is
a homonymous function withing validations_libs[2] intended
for a same task.

Docstring and tests were adjusted accordingly. Minor docstring typo was fixed.

[0]https://docs.python.org/3/library/subprocess.html#popen-objects
[1]https://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=run_command_and_log&i=nope&literal=nope&files=&excludeFiles=&repos=
[2]https://opendev.org/openstack/validations-libs/src/branch/master/validations_libs/utils.py#L607

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-22 12:39:20.000000000', 'message': "Removing TODO lacking sufficient description

Note doesn't adress why would logging outputs into a file be preferrable
to existing arrangement. No bug ID or link is present either.

Furthermore, using logger instance to handle messages is widespread practice
both across the client and Openstack. Changing it, so that output is logged directly
into file wouldn't be conductive to long term consistency of the code.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7661ca354fc269732d7150a697a42d0d3d9dbaea
"}]
commit_message:
Removing TODO lacking sufficient description

Note doesn't adress why would logging outputs into a file be preferrable
to existing arrangement. No bug ID or link is present either.

Furthermore, using logger instance to handle messages is widespread practice
both across the client and Openstack. Changing it, so that output is logged directly
into file wouldn't be conductive to long term consistency of the code.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7661ca354fc269732d7150a697a42d0d3d9dbaea

commit_message:
Fix symbol identification in multiline message

* Fix an issue where a multiline message with leading spaces would cause
  invalid symbol identification.
* Add unit-tests around multiple symbols in a single line

Sem-Ver: bugfix
Change-Id: Id799c2fd368d9df38a5c01fc2071283aecef67c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-26 07:31:58.000000000', 'message': 'Skip returning unwanted internal data to user

Various RestFul APIs returns below internal unwanted data to the user:-

trust_id of a lease
resource_id of a reservation
aggregate_id of an instance reservation
trust_id of a host

This patch will not return above data if the micro version is 1.1.

APIImpact:
1)For micro version 1.1, trust_id of a lease, resource_id of a
reservation, aggregate_id of an instance reservation are not
returned in response while creating, updating and getting
the lease.

2)For micro version 1.1, trust_id of a host is not returned in
response while creating, updating and getting the host.

Change-Id: Ie6205af3052c972cdb6fb8a9f00afa5c2c8d72a7
Closes-Bug: #1740091

commit_message:
Skip returning unwanted internal data to user

Various RestFul APIs returns below internal unwanted data to the user:-

trust_id of a lease
resource_id of a reservation
aggregate_id of an instance reservation
trust_id of a host

This patch will not return above data if the microversion is 1.1.

APIImpact:
1)For microversion 1.1, trust_id of a lease, resource_id of a
reservation, aggregate_id of an instance reservation are not returned
in response while creating, updating and getting the lease.

2)For microversion 1.1, trust_id of a host is not returned in
response while creating, updating and getting the host.

Change-Id: Ie6205af3052c972cdb6fb8a9f00afa5c2c8d72a7
Closes-Bug: #1740091

commit_message:
Add new fips jobs and create template for periodic

This patch adds a set of standlone jobs' definition with fips
enabled. Creates a new project template with all fips jobs on
periodic pipeline.

Change-Id: I839830a5efb257c2c4407e6f43c8c47ab68aec0a
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2022-07-18 15:55:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2022-07-18 15:55:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/ironic on branch master.  The error was:

  Unknown projects: opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder

The error appears in the following job stanza:

  job:
      name: ironic-base
      abstract: true
      description: Base job for devstack/tempest based ironic jobs.
      parent: devstack-tempest
      nodeset: openstack-single-node-focal
      post-run: playbooks/ci-workarounds/get_extra_logging.yaml
      timeout: 10800
      required-projects:
        # TODO(TheJulia): Explicitly pull in DIB until we get a release cut.
        - opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder
        - opendev.org/openstack/ironic
        - opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent
        - opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent-builder
        - opendev.org/openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin
        - opendev.org/openstack/virtualbmc
      irrelevant-files:
        - ^.*\.rst$
        - ^api-ref/.*$
        - ^doc/.*$
        - ^driver-requirements.txt$
        - ^install-guide/.*$
        - ^ironic/locale/.*$
        - ^ironic/tests/.*$
        - ^releasenotes/.*$
        - ^setup.cfg$
        - ^test-requirements.txt$
        - ^tox.ini$
      vars:
        tox_envlist: all
        tempest_test_timeout: 2400
        tempest_test_regex: ironic_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario
        tempest_concurrency: 1
        devstack_localrc:
          DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE: baremetal
          FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE: True
          INSTALL_TEMPEST: False # Don't install a tempest package globaly
          VIRT_DRIVER: ironic
          BUILD_TIMEOUT: 1800
          IRONIC_BAREMETAL_BASIC_OPS: True
          IRONIC_BUILD_DEPLOY_RAMDISK: False
          IRONIC_CALLBACK_TIMEOUT: 1800
          IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER: ipmi
          IRONIC_INSPECTOR_BUILD_RAMDISK: False
          IRONIC_INSPECTOR_TEMPEST_INTROSPECTION_TIMEOUT: 1200
          IRONIC_TEMPEST_BUILD_TIMEOUT: 1800
          IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE: False
          IRONIC_VM_COUNT: 2
          IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK: 1
          IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM: 2600
          IRONIC_VM_LOG_DIR: '{{ devstack_base_dir }}/ironic-bm-logs'
          # NOTE(dtantsur): in some jobs we end up with 12 disks total, so reduce
          # each of them. For don't need all 10 GiB for CirrOS anyway.
          IRONIC_VM_SPECS_DISK: 4
          IRONIC_VM_SPECS_CPU: 2
          Q_AGENT: openvswitch
          Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE: vxlan
          Q_ML2_PLUGIN_MECHANISM_DRIVERS: openvswitch
          SERVICE_TIMEOUT: 90
          # NOTE(TheJulia): Devstack default glance limit is 1GB, we need
          # something more like 5GB for baremetal jobs due to image sizes
          # with firmware.
          GLANCE_LIMIT_IMAGE_SIZE_TOTAL: 5000
          # NOTE(TheJulia): Disable neutron firewall as bug
          # https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1944201
          # causes us an abnormally high job failure rate due to the ports
          # not being found (as neutron crashed on initailization).
          Q_USE_SECGROUP: False
          # Default API workers is 2, however only 1 is needed,
          # which cuts API memory utilziation in half reducing the risk of
          # oom-killer events in CI.
          API_WORKERS: 1
        devstack_plugins:
          ironic: https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic
        tempest_plugins:
          - ironic-tempest-plugin
        zuul_copy_output:
          '{{ devstack_base_dir }}/ironic-bm-logs': 'logs'
          '{{ devstack_base_dir }}/data/networking-generic-switch/netmiko_session.log': 'logs'
        devstack_services:
          # TODO: re-enable dstat once https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008185
          # is resolved
          dstat: false
          q-agt: true
          q-dhcp: true
          q-l3: true
          q-meta: true
          q-metering: true
          q-svc: true
          ovn-controller: false
          ovn-northd: false
          q-ovn-metadata-agent: false
          c-api: False
          c-bak: False
          c-sch: False
          c-vol: False
          cinder: False
          s-account: False
          s-container: False
          s-object: False
          s-proxy: False

  in "openstack/ironic/zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml@master", line 1, column 3
For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_Ironic_CI'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2022-07-18 17:17:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/ironic on branch master.  The error was:

  Unknown projects: opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder

The error appears in the following job stanza:

  job:
      name: ironic-base
      abstract: true
      description: Base job for devstack/tempest based ironic jobs.
      parent: devstack-tempest
      nodeset: openstack-single-node-focal
      post-run: playbooks/ci-workarounds/get_extra_logging.yaml
      timeout: 10800
      required-projects:
        # TODO(TheJulia): Explicitly pull in DIB until we get a release cut.
        - opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder
        - opendev.org/openstack/ironic
        - opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent
        - opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent-builder
        - opendev.org/openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin
        - opendev.org/openstack/virtualbmc
      irrelevant-files:
        - ^.*\.rst$
        - ^api-ref/.*$
        - ^doc/.*$
        - ^driver-requirements.txt$
        - ^install-guide/.*$
        - ^ironic/locale/.*$
        - ^ironic/tests/.*$
        - ^releasenotes/.*$
        - ^setup.cfg$
        - ^test-requirements.txt$
        - ^tox.ini$
      vars:
        tox_envlist: all
        tempest_test_timeout: 2400
        tempest_test_regex: ironic_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario
        tempest_concurrency: 1
        devstack_localrc:
          DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE: baremetal
          FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE: True
          INSTALL_TEMPEST: False # Don't install a tempest package globaly
          VIRT_DRIVER: ironic
          BUILD_TIMEOUT: 1800
          IRONIC_BAREMETAL_BASIC_OPS: True
          IRONIC_BUILD_DEPLOY_RAMDISK: False
          IRONIC_CALLBACK_TIMEOUT: 1800
          IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER: ipmi
          IRONIC_INSPECTOR_BUILD_RAMDISK: False
          IRONIC_INSPECTOR_TEMPEST_INTROSPECTION_TIMEOUT: 1200
          IRONIC_TEMPEST_BUILD_TIMEOUT: 1800
          IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE: False
          IRONIC_VM_COUNT: 2
          IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK: 1
          IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM: 2600
          IRONIC_VM_LOG_DIR: '{{ devstack_base_dir }}/ironic-bm-logs'
          # NOTE(dtantsur): in some jobs we end up with 12 disks total, so reduce
          # each of them. For don't need all 10 GiB for CirrOS anyway.
          IRONIC_VM_SPECS_DISK: 4
          IRONIC_VM_SPECS_CPU: 2
          Q_AGENT: openvswitch
          Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE: vxlan
          Q_ML2_PLUGIN_MECHANISM_DRIVERS: openvswitch
          SERVICE_TIMEOUT: 90
          # NOTE(TheJulia): Devstack default glance limit is 1GB, we need
          # something more like 5GB for baremetal jobs due to image sizes
          # with firmware.
          GLANCE_LIMIT_IMAGE_SIZE_TOTAL: 5000
          # NOTE(TheJulia): Disable neutron firewall as bug
          # https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1944201
          # causes us an abnormally high job failure rate due to the ports
          # not being found (as neutron crashed on initailization).
          Q_USE_SECGROUP: False
          # Default API workers is 2, however only 1 is needed,
          # which cuts API memory utilziation in half reducing the risk of
          # oom-killer events in CI.
          API_WORKERS: 1
        devstack_plugins:
          ironic: https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic
        tempest_plugins:
          - ironic-tempest-plugin
        zuul_copy_output:
          '{{ devstack_base_dir }}/ironic-bm-logs': 'logs'
          '{{ devstack_base_dir }}/data/networking-generic-switch/netmiko_session.log': 'logs'
        devstack_services:
          # TODO: re-enable dstat once https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008185
          # is resolved
          dstat: false
          q-agt: true
          q-dhcp: true
          q-l3: true
          q-meta: true
          q-metering: true
          q-svc: true
          ovn-controller: false
          ovn-northd: false
          q-ovn-metadata-agent: false
          c-api: False
          c-bak: False
          c-sch: False
          c-vol: False
          cinder: False
          s-account: False
          s-container: False
          s-object: False
          s-proxy: False

  in "openstack/ironic/zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml@master", line 1, column 3

commit_message:
Finally remove support for netboot and the boot_option capability

Instance network boot (not to be confused with ramdisk, iSCSI or
anaconda deploy methods) is insecure, underused and difficult to
maintain. This change removes a lot of related code from Ironic.

The so called "netboot fallback" is still supported for legacy boot when
boot device management is not available or is unreliable.

Change-Id: Ia8510e4acac6dec0a1e4f5cb0e07008548a00c52

commit_message:
cephadm: Use distro-provided Quincy on Jammy

Ubuntu Jammy will only support Ceph Quincy.
Workaround for now - use Jammy in-distro packages for cephadm.

Change-Id: I30f071865b9b0751f1336414a0ae82571a332530

commit_message:
[wallaby-only] Ability to skip create_ceph_ansible_remote_tmp command

This patch introduces a tag to allow the external upgrade run command,
executed during the cephadm adoption, to skip the create ceph-ansible
remote tmp playbook, created due to bug [1] when the deployment tool
was ceph-ansible.

[1] ansible/ansible#68218

Change-Id: Ied61b690af51266c2d05f54f00d2cd1e12c30a24

[{'created': '2022-06-15 11:49:41.000000000', 'message': 'Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Change-Id: I649f852e1dc01d4a5ed1b9d6a35b27b7027cb263
'}]
commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Change-Id: I649f852e1dc01d4a5ed1b9d6a35b27b7027cb263

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Change-Id: I513a9a9a09248b7e9ae01c4597dd38723f392e68

commit_message:
Refactor issues and procedures

Centralise all noteworthy issues and procedures into a
single page. This will make it much simpler for users to
find important information and will reduce the necessity
to include multiple links in many pages.

Move the placement charm procedure to its own special charm
procedure page and link to it from the stein:train upgrade
path page.

The new page is currently in the Upgrades section but this
is temporary. It will soon be migrated to the charm-guide
where it will be placed under the Project section.

Include an HTML redirect (and test) for the former
upgrade-special page.

Change-Id: I3a8abe0d6b82447ca6d2883065cb1a2ce6d906b9

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Ic65dbb3f89fadd5046d69da9dbafc856a402c6f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-08-04 07:53:30.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid unnecessary db calls with l2pop

When processing ports that are incompatible with l2_population,
certain methods do unnecessary db calls to retrieve agent port
info from the db. This info is used only if the processed
port is of the correct network type. The check is done after
the db call, but before the info is used.

This commit moves the check earlier in the method. The db will
be called only when the port is supposed to be set up with the
l2pop.

Closes-Bug: #1983558
Change-Id: I5a83bfce60a933af781b1fd96037c7de6b2b1f38
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid unnecessary db calls with l2pop

When processing ports that are incompatible with l2_population,
certain methods do unnecessary db calls to retrieve agent port
info from the db. This info is used only if the processed
port is of the correct network type. The check is done after
the db call, but before the info is used.

This commit moves the check earlier in the method. The db will
be called only when the port is supposed to be set up with the
l2pop.

Closes-Bug: #1983558
Change-Id: I5a83bfce60a933af781b1fd96037c7de6b2b1f38

commit_message:
Force chrony sources online

NetworkManager can invoke onoffline which may offline the sources.
During the deployment let's force the sources online prior to waiting
for them to sync.

Change-Id: Id27dba9fc2f36e9eeff09cce57e9153c74d2a392
Related-Bug: #1958116

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Change-Id: Ic615e7b994abc669a04999b5711c53c6b51d7915

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

commit_message:
Set tenant_id on router_centralized_snat ports

When creating a network:router_centralized_snat port, we should set a
project_id just like we do for network:router_interface_distributed.

Related-Bug: #1899502

Change-Id: Ibf4c904f794040e757e91c299c64a4c8cde2b288
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-28 09:33:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix Redfish RAID for non-immediate controllers

Fixes ``redfish`` RAID interface workflow to not create more than 1
logical disks per controller at the same time when controller does not
support 'Immediate' application time and system needs rebooting.

With this fix virtual disks are grouped by controller and executed
in batches when reboot is required.

This enables ``redfish`` RAID interface to be used with iDRAC systems
directly as although there are many controllers that support 'Immediate'
application time, they do it only when system has completed loading.
System intermittently completes loading after IPA starts executing
clean or deploy steps rendering controllers not supporting 'Immediate'
apply time and requiring reboot. This fix handles such scenario
instead of failing to create more than 1 virtual disk.

Story: 2009863
Task: 44529

 Conflicts:
       ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/raid.py

Change-Id: Ia2ce34f09695731b0f48798f662006c4904e2223
(cherry picked from commit d7d8f8754b36af4b686ce540e699fc5cb945c10c)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Redfish RAID for non-immediate controllers

Fixes ``redfish`` RAID interface workflow to not create more than 1
logical disks per controller at the same time when controller does not
support 'Immediate' application time and system needs rebooting.

With this fix virtual disks are grouped by controller and executed
in batches when reboot is required.

This enables ``redfish`` RAID interface to be used with iDRAC systems
directly as although there are many controllers that support 'Immediate'
application time, they do it only when system has completed loading.
System intermittently completes loading after IPA starts executing
clean or deploy steps rendering controllers not supporting 'Immediate'
apply time and requiring reboot. This fix handles such scenario
instead of failing to create more than 1 virtual disk.

Story: 2009863
Task: 44529

 Conflicts:
       ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/raid.py

Change-Id: Ia2ce34f09695731b0f48798f662006c4904e2223
(cherry picked from commit d7d8f8754b36af4b686ce540e699fc5cb945c10c)

commit_message:
disable compression when running with mitogen

Mitogen performs better when running without compression. This change
ensures that compression is disabled by default.

Change-Id: I4179660ea969cbdf13c558e3b6889ca00d315330
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[update] Ansible needs to be updated as well.

Currently, we exclude ansible from the undercloud update because
Ansible cannot update itself[1].

We still need to get Ansible updated, so we add it to the list of
package that need to be updated before the actual update runs.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/56636

Change-Id: I9fcfe197881d758196328410e57a12013d9d9d41

commit_message:
[update] Let Ansible update Ansible on the Overcloud.

Ansible doesn't support updating itself[1] when running on the same
node but it can update the ansible package on remote node.

As the undercloud uses the "Update all packages" task from the
undercloud-upgrade.yaml file we can safely modify the
tripleo-packages-baremetal-puppet.yaml to update Ansible on the
Overcloud.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/56636

Change-Id: I7bf2553efd6b02a2f5738c88449ee32f3b511057

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-04 15:29:23.000000000', 'message': 'Creating a nova-libvirt debug container

When it's time to troubleshoot libvirt/qemu crashes, having the debug
packages might be necessary.

There are some tedious ways to install the 'debuginfo' packages, such as
taking the approach to build hotfixes[1].  This can be error-prone, or
just plain not feasible, for whatever reasons.

Instead, we should consider the option to ship libvirt (and perhaps
QEMU) 'debuginfo' builds — which are often heavy in size — in a separate
container or "some other way" that makes this simpler.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1954717

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/deployment/container_image_prepare.html#building-hotfixed-containers

Change-Id: Ic44ff99b59fe32eb686e7b65ceae38fda790025b

commit_message:
Creating a nova-libvirt debug container

When it's time to troubleshoot libvirt/qemu crashes, having the debug
packages might be necessary.

There are some tedious ways to install the 'debuginfo' packages, such as
taking the approach to build hotfixes[1].  This can be error-prone, or
just plain not feasible, for whatever reasons.

Instead, we should consider the option to ship libvirt (and perhaps
QEMU) 'debuginfo' builds — which are often heavy in size — in a separate
container or "some other way" that makes this simpler.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1954717

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/deployment/container_image_prepare.html#building-hotfixed-containers

Change-Id: Ic44ff99b59fe32eb686e7b65ceae38fda790025b

Update molecule image container to centos stream 9

Centos stream 8 container is failing due some package dependence
conflict, updating to stream 9 since we are no longer supporting centos
8 in master branch.

Change-Id: I741a60eec508ad4c08ef417461b98bf2428f5825

subject: Respect haproxy_bind_internal_lb_vip_* variables
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-08-05 09:08:57.000000000', 'message': 'Respect haproxy_bind_internal_lb_vip_* variables

At the moment we assume that haproxy should be fine listening on
internal_lb_vip_address, but in real life deployments these are FQDN
and in case of using DNS RR, this assumption is invalid.

We can be smarter and check if haproxy_bind_internal_lb_vip_* variables
are defined, and fallback to previous behaviour if not.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/+/852039
Change-Id: Ic0b9646d566425878930eb88745e35f9e6cc2e11
'}]
commit_message:
Respect haproxy_bind_internal_lb_vip_* variables

At the moment we assume that haproxy should be fine listening on
internal_lb_vip_address, but in real life deployments these are FQDN
and in case of using DNS RR, this assumption is invalid.

We can be smarter and check if haproxy_bind_internal_lb_vip_* variables
are defined, and fallback to previous behaviour if not.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/+/852039
Change-Id: Ic0b9646d566425878930eb88745e35f9e6cc2e11

commit_message:
Node configuration settings documentation realignment

Existing documentation of the node configuration settings was
no longer representative of the actual settings, nor of the
contents of the files referenced.

This patch changes docs to point user to correct files, and provides
more recent and accurate example of node configuration.

Code blocks were reformatted to improve readability.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1d105501fbc56fc5c86d8381d2173129be6fe7b4

Ironic: Manage [disk_utils] parameters by puppet

This change enables the separate class to manage the [disk_utils]
paramers so that users can use puppet parameters to manage options
in this section.

commit_message:
Support mariabackup as a galera SST method

In addition to rsync and rsync tunnelled over socat,
expose the ability to use mariabackup in galera config.

Related-Bug: #1973872

Change-Id: I4d5983ada52a58cdd853bd7b701bb11eeb88be8d
(cherry picked from commit 0d6db2428b2589f458328cc30445a963eeb863ee)
(cherry picked from commit 688354081b782a526166d5d1416a104c096a0c21)

commit_message:
Add load_balancer.RBAC_test_type: "keystone_default_roles"

The policy override file was updated in the Octavia package [0], the old
"owner_or_admin" override file was switched to the
"keystone_default_roles" file.
Now the configuration for octavia-tempest-plugin must be updated
accordingly. This commit sets the [load_balancer]/RBAC_test_type
setting from tempest.conf to keystone_default_roles on master and stable
branches.

Member role is no longer needed.

[0] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/octavia-distgit/+/43788

Closes-Bug: #1981829
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I31e4ef262d735f586d2fe45d94b19b0a61197c00

subject: Do not place debian.cnf when root user not touched
messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2022-06-24 08:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2022-08-04 22:08:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2022-08-05 08:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-24 08:46:28.000000000', 'message': "Do not place debian.cnf when root user not touched

We used to overwrite /etc/mysql/debian.cnf file that is provided by
package when we were resetting root password for mariadb. That was
required as otherwise systemd couldn't manage service properly.
Now, when galera_root_user can be different then root, we don't need to
do this and can rely on defaults.

Change-Id: Ia8305121900d28aca28a80c6c9d6a664aec40214
Closes-Bug: #1979726
"}]
commit_message:
Do not place debian.cnf when root user not touched

We used to overwrite /etc/mysql/debian.cnf file that is provided by
package when we were resetting root password for mariadb. That was
required as otherwise systemd couldn't manage service properly.
Now, when galera_root_user can be different then root, we don't need to
do this and can rely on defaults.

Change-Id: Ia8305121900d28aca28a80c6c9d6a664aec40214
Closes-Bug: #1979726

commit_message:
remove unicode literal from code

All strings are considered as unicode string from Python 3.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: I06cead907a0fbc019eece1305d505c4e153363a9

commit_message:
Remove stable/victoria job from master gate

stable/victoria is in EM state and Tempest is pinned
there so we do not need to test the stable/victoria
jobs on master gate.

Change-Id: I40ac5019b6d8ce4473af32d2fc5bb48e75abdcc3

and potentially confusing. As without inserted whitspace the code may look as a function
call, rather than a statement and expression.

The construct is also considered erroneous by linters.

Closes-Bug: 1983593

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0a086a8349e2a72cae024857e148fddc3556c319
'}]
commit_message:
Removing brackets around tested conditional

While permissible syntactically, using brackets to wrap tested conditional is unnecessary
and potentially confusing. As without inserted whitspace the code may look as a function
call, rather than a statement and expression.

The construct is also considered erroneous by linters.

Closes-Bug: 1983593

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0a086a8349e2a72cae024857e148fddc3556c319

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-08-04 00:54:51.000000000', 'message': '[ovn]Change LogicalSwitchPortUpdateUpEvent old conditions

Sometimes when creating ports, the status of logical_switch_port
changes from [] to [true]. we should be able to deal with this
situation and ensure that the port is in the active state in neutron.

Closes-bug: #1983530

Change-Id: I99d2a8078dd7acde72b232a5b1de826d7e1d60f3
'}]
commit_message:
[ovn]Change LogicalSwitchPortUpdateUpEvent old conditions

Sometimes when creating ports, the status of logical_switch_port
changes from [] to [true]. we should be able to deal with this
situation and ensure that the port is in the active state in neutron.

Closes-bug: #1983530

Change-Id: I99d2a8078dd7acde72b232a5b1de826d7e1d60f3

commit_message:
feat: update volume action menu

1. Update the volume action menu: classified as 'data protection', 'instance related', 'capacity & type'
2. Update the volume action menu in the volume tab in the  instance detail page
3. Update the volume/snapshot e2e cases according the new action menu

Change-Id: Ib479efcdcd0f72789b1278716c7b9f06f9d87d3b

2. Fix the server group member label in the quota manange form
3. Update the label style in the quota manage form to better display the
resource label

Remove Python 2 support

Python 2 has been deprecated. This patch removes all
traces of six, unicode strings and Python 2 tweaks.

commit_message:
Replace abc.abstractproperty with property and abc.abstractmethod

Replace abc.abstractproperty with property and abc.abstractmethod,
as abc.abstractproperty has been deprecated since python3.3[1]

[1]https://docs.python.org/3.8/whatsnew/3.3.html?highlight=deprecated#abc

Change-Id: Idfaf5bb3a0552f1128416821de58dc8e1bb584f0

commit_message:
Update openeEuler pkg mapping

openEuler 22.03 supports python3 only. There is no
python-devel package.

This patch update the pkg mapping to fix the package
install problem in nodepool.

Change-Id: I11750048841ec49c893b4c9332a6029b329b54cb

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Change-Id: I0d78dab73eb53195087f0bd50ed8d3d4d9e73869

commit_message:
Replace deprecated readfp method with read_file

The readfp method has been deprecated since version 3.2 [1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/configparser.html?highlight=deprecated#configparser.ConfigParser.readfp

Change-Id: I34b5cb48a2f808e8d10f5fef95908fdc3ad7fde5

'}, {'created': '2022-07-22 07:39:52.000000000', 'message': "Fix indirect reference to hieradata

Since we replaced hiera by lookup[1], we no longer able to look up
a hierata value which refers to a different value by lookup, and
the hiera CLI fails with the following error.

```
in `get_interpolation_method_and_key': Invalid interpolation method
'lookup' (Hiera::InterpolationInvalidValue)
```

This replaces indirect reference by direct reference to avoid that
problem.

[1] ff83505e8ac6575e65116eb565bcb613536bfcf2

Change-Id: I05d5490734f49220002bd88294db132da9fb2898
"}, {'created': '2022-07-22 08:30:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix indirect reference to hieradata

Since we replaced hiera by lookup[1], we no longer able to look up
a hierata value which refers to a different value by lookup, and
the hiera CLI fails with the following error.

```
in `get_interpolation_method_and_key': Invalid interpolation method
'lookup' (Hiera::InterpolationInvalidValue)
```

This replaces indirect reference by direct reference to avoid that
problem.

[1] ff83505e8ac6575e65116eb565bcb613536bfcf2

Change-Id: I05d5490734f49220002bd88294db132da9fb2898
"}]
commit_message:
Fix indirect reference to hieradata

Since we replaced hiera by lookup[1], we no longer able to look up
a hierata value which refers to a different value by lookup, and
the hiera CLI fails with the following error.

```
in `get_interpolation_method_and_key': Invalid interpolation method
'lookup' (Hiera::InterpolationInvalidValue)
```

This replaces indirect reference by direct reference to avoid that
problem.

[1] ff83505e8ac6575e65116eb565bcb613536bfcf2

Change-Id: I05d5490734f49220002bd88294db132da9fb2898

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-08-03 03:32:46.000000000', 'message': "Make single resume point for all host prep tasks

Currently host prep tasks are executed concurrently over multiple roles
using tripleo_free strategy, so it's not quite useful to allow users to
resume from host prep tasks for specific role. Unless the user select
the proper point, it can cause some tasks effectively skipped.

This merges the debug task into a single one, so that users can start
the deployment with executing host prep tasks for all nodes by a more
simple way.

Change-Id: I79ff5d3babd05c7d1ba5195f372c1348d6692e2b
"}, {'created': '2022-08-03 04:10:26.000000000', 'message': 'Make single resume point for all host prep tasks

Currently host prep tasks are executed by tripleo_free strategy and
it does not ensure one task/block is completed before it moves to
the next task/block, and each node might be executing a different
task/block of the playbook.

When deployment fails at certain role, it might not be enough to resume
from that role because there might be some tasks not yet completed in
a different role. For example with current implementation, host prep
tasks can fail at both Controller and Compute. In this case users need
to look into the rendered playbook to find out which role comes first
and start from that role(likely Controller, because it is defined
before Compute in roles_data.yaml). If they select a wrong point then
some tasks might be effectively skipped.

This merges the multiple debug tasks for individual roles into a single
one, so that users can start the deployment with executing host prep
tasks. This is more simple and stable way to ensure host prep tasks are
executed for all nodes/all roles in the deployment.

Change-Id: I79ff5d3babd05c7d1ba5195f372c1348d6692e2b
'}, {'created': '2022-08-03 04:11:59.000000000', 'message': 'Make single resume point for all host prep tasks

Currently host prep tasks are executed by tripleo_free strategy and
it does not ensure one task/block is completed before it moves to
the next task/block, and each node might be executing a different
task/block of the playbook.

When deployment fails at a certain role, it might not be enough to
resume from that role because there might be some tasks not yet
completed in a different role. For example host prep asks can fail at
 both Controller and Compute. In this case users need to look into
the rendered playbook to find out which role comes first and start from
that role(likely Controller, because it is defined before Compute in
roles_data.yaml). If they select a wrong point then some tasks might be
effectively skipped.

This merges the multiple debug tasks for individual roles into a single
one, so that users can start the deployment with executing host prep
tasks. This is more simple and stable way to ensure host prep tasks are
executed for all nodes/all roles in the deployment.

Change-Id: I79ff5d3babd05c7d1ba5195f372c1348d6692e2b
'}, {'created': '2022-08-03 07:41:38.000000000', 'message': 'Change --start-at-task for plays using tripleo_free

With tripleo_free strategy a playbook run fails only after the
end of the play. In case a task failure for a node, the other nodes
keep continuing till the end of play. Therefore, --start-at-task
should be always at the beginning of the play as different nodes
can fail at different tasks and we need to always start from the
start of play.

Change-Id: I79ff5d3babd05c7d1ba5195f372c1348d6692e2b
'}, {'created': '2022-08-03 07:51:46.000000000', 'message': 'Change --start-at-task for plays using tripleo_free

With tripleo_free strategy a playbook run fails only after the
end of the play. In case a task failure for a node, the other nodes
keep continuing till the end of play. Therefore, --start-at-task
should be always at the beginning of the play as different nodes
can fail at different tasks and we need to always start from the
start of play.

Change-Id: I79ff5d3babd05c7d1ba5195f372c1348d6692e2b
'}, {'created': '2022-08-03 10:27:51.000000000', 'message': 'Change --start-at-task for plays using tripleo_free

With tripleo_free strategy a playbook run fails only after the
end of the play. In case a task failure for a node, the other nodes
keep continuing till the end of play. Therefore, --start-at-task
should be always at the beginning of the play as different nodes
can fail at different tasks and we need to always start from the
start of play.

Change-Id: I79ff5d3babd05c7d1ba5195f372c1348d6692e2b
'}]
commit_message:
Change --start-at-task for plays using tripleo_free

With tripleo_free strategy a playbook run fails only after the
end of the play. In case a task failure for a node, the other nodes
keep continuing till the end of play. Therefore, --start-at-task
should be always at the beginning of the play as different nodes
can fail at different tasks and we need to always start from the
start of play.

Change-Id: I79ff5d3babd05c7d1ba5195f372c1348d6692e2b

commit_message:
Control rally-openstack installed version

At the moment we don't have control what version of rally-openstack
is being installed. So we are installing latest version available in
PyPi. However rally package version is defined in
rally-openstack constraints.

With this patch we add variables to be able to adjust source of
rally-openstack as well as pick version for installation.

We also temporary disable upgrade jobs to resolve circular dependency

Change-Id: I8100dfd3544c0530815fb877b44b960d404f635b
(cherry picked from commit 136dfa02d050454d3b663186a212184a86b63c3e)

commit_message:
Replace abc.abstractproperty with property and abc.abstractmethod

Replace abc.abstractproperty with property and abc.abstractmethod,
as abc.abstractproperty has been deprecated since python3.3[1]

[1]https://docs.python.org/3.8/whatsnew/3.3.html?highlight=deprecated#abc

Change-Id: Iab86cf42e5b6dbd2181594fb0fab0263ddb7a6f5

commit_message:
Add some notes and example for vxlan support

With the nftables switch, we may need to add some custom rules in order
to make it work properly. Those rules aren't really needed for iptables
engine, but they won't hurt nor break things.

Change-Id: Id660262fe2879d773a0af1c508856b5083db6c37

commit_message:
Support standard partition type GUIDs

This change adds GUID detection for mounting /boot and /boot/efi.

Closes-Bug: #1983467

commit_message:
Configure podman netavark network - enable IPv6

In RHEL9 the default container networking used is "netavark".
With this change the default "podman" network is configured to
enable IPv6 networking for containers.

The default IPv4 IP address used is updated the match the ones used
in tripleo with "cni" networking.

Also, when "netavark" is the backend skip the tasks that do cni related
configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1983121
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/851597
Change-Id: I90efb1639d7ffd899ab73446620354403c1ca536
(cherry picked from commit 1a87dad727c2e9db4620cf7987762971ea176929)

commit_message:
Remove six

Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.PY2
- six.text_type
- six.string_type
- six.binary_type
- six.iterkeys
- six.moves
- six.itervalues

Implements: blueprint six-removal

Change-Id: I6195ceeeed2ebe1586973eaeef7fa9f29698fec2

commit_message:
Add validation to share network

Adds a check when associating a security service to a share network, so
that both resources must have the same project_id. If not,
a HTTP Bad Request is raised. Affiliated tests were altered or created.

Closes-Bug: #1918323
Change-Id: Idb2a8838d492ac3c616fb21ab1272f7dc74ee589
(cherry picked from commit a97d65d3eb9b3a5b4a88a1b3f22b59ca2f75c9bc)
(cherry picked from commit 95099bdfc46f4734c082b051a0029627aff9e473)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-08 19:14:26.000000000', 'message': "Support multiple mounts without explicit nbd devices

Currently the default nbd device is /dev/nbd0, so mounting and
unmounting one image works without specifying a -n argument.

However mounting multiple images requires an explicit correct -n
/dev/nbdX for both tripleo-mount-image and tripleo-unmount-image
calls, which gets difficult to manage.

This change fixes that by choosing an appropriate NBD device in each
case. For mount, the lsblk PTTYPE is set for devices in use, so
iterate the devices until a free one is found. For unmount, look at
the 'mount -l' output and trace the root mount path back to the NBD
device which is in use.

Change-Id: I1f221f3fb4dd70c919168d52c53e03c3b2535c04

commit_message:
Support multiple mounts without explicit nbd devices

Currently the default nbd device is /dev/nbd0, so mounting and
unmounting one image works without specifying a -n argument.

However mounting multiple images requires an explicit correct -n
/dev/nbdX for both tripleo-mount-image and tripleo-unmount-image
calls, which gets difficult to manage.

This change fixes that by choosing an appropriate NBD device in each
case. For mount, the lsblk PTTYPE is set for devices in use, so
iterate the devices until a free one is found. For unmount, look at
the 'mount -l' output and trace the root mount path back to the NBD
device which is in use.

Change-Id: I1f221f3fb4dd70c919168d52c53e03c3b2535c04
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/852068

in Host prep block to avoid the issue.

commit_message:
Use conditions with Host prep block tasks

Ansible free/tripleo_free strategies do not work well
for blocks with conditions, containing include_tasks.
Conditions ( i.e when: ) at times get mixed up resulting
in wrong condition being evaluated. As blocks are only
logical entities (conditions evaluated per task), we
shouldn't have any problem moving the conditions to tasks
in Host prep block to avoid the issue.

This fixes intermittent chrony failures in host_prep_tasks.

Note: This is a workaround as we've to backport it all
the way till train and has to be fixed in core ansible[1]
in the future.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/60512

Resolves: rhbz#2084075
Resolves: rhbz#2111237
Change-Id: Id9f481f3fe75169bd4c3d721e23e847a1b6c8c43
(cherry picked from commit e728e8cc8e2442b092c3f4f5d6e0296a779cd3dd)
(cherry picked from commit 492005071abfcb010292ad464cb26ecb2babef25)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-08-04 17:21:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix reference to deprecated quota_driver option

The commit 76cfc9405ea8b318e8b1c589fa245f86a5827b71 moved all quota_*
options to the separate quota section but the commit missed one usage
of the old quota_driver option, and the remaining usage causes
the following warning warning to appear repeatedly.

Config option None.quota_driver is deprecated.
Use option quota.driver instead.

This replaces the remaining usage to get rid of that warning.

Related-Bug: #1934025
Closes-Bug: #1983125
Change-Id: Ie49dbe4633a34d1832f0dedb658d83ec74d351df
(cherry picked from commit 68a5e93ff9ba00b58804ad8b9d12d48cdc25802f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix reference to deprecated quota_driver option

The commit 76cfc9405ea8b318e8b1c589fa245f86a5827b71 moved all quota_*
options to the separate quota section but the commit missed one usage
of the old quota_driver option, and the remaining usage causes
the following warning warning to appear repeatedly.

Config option None.quota_driver is deprecated.
Use option quota.driver instead.

This replaces the remaining usage to get rid of that warning.

Related-Bug: #1934025
Closes-Bug: #1983125
Change-Id: Ie49dbe4633a34d1832f0dedb658d83ec74d351df
(cherry picked from commit 68a5e93ff9ba00b58804ad8b9d12d48cdc25802f)

commit_message:
Define queues at project level

Defining queues at project.pipeline level was deprecated in release
4.1.0 of Zuul [1] and support for it will (probably) be dropped in
release 7.0.0. [2][3]

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul/latest/releasenotes.html#relnotes-4-1-0-deprecation-notes
[2] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-May/028603.html
[3] https://lists.zuul-ci.org/pipermail/zuul-discuss/2022-May/001801.html

Signed-off-by: Eduardo Santos <eduardo.experimental@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ife023187f307f1190d5e76daf644db0b5cd55d38
(cherry picked from commit 441d6470ca3a24f29f60494ed31755d2842b2fa3)

commit_message:
Update kibana index pattern creation

This change updates the kibana indices creation to repeatedly make
call attempts until we get a 200 response back.

Change-Id: Id0f012bda83913fc66c4ce105de97496043e487c

Tempita should be removed as much as possible and having it in a
 low level layer like this causes it to be installed in charms
which do not require it.

'}]
commit_message:
Remove Tempita as it is unsupoorted

Tempita should be removed as much as possible and having it in a
 low level layer like this causes it to be installed in charms
which do not require it.

Change-Id: I7d06601ff4c316cf4325196116b10e108dc17eed

commit_message:
Use swift_store_endpoint if set with Keystone v3

The swift_store_endpoint config option doesn't appear to work with
Keystone v3. Updating _get_storage_url to return the value from
swift_store_endpoint if present.

Change-Id: I615e9a1a0eadfaf191c9282638883e3849f9a00a
Closes-Bug: 1885651

commit_message:
New dedicated user for Galera SST synchronization

When the Galera is configured to use mariabackup, the
synchronization takes place by connecting to the
database with configuratble user credentials.
Generate a random password for this use case.

Related-Bug: #1973872

(Fixed merge conflict manually to prevent backporting
Ic7ff36a5f3f4eceeb6c8a338093e956b7db00533 with it)

Change-Id: I1509bd30fbd253790b17e04ef15dca6c58de7311

commit_message:
Fix reference to deprecated quota_driver option

The commit 76cfc9405ea8b318e8b1c589fa245f86a5827b71 moved all quota_*
options to the separate quota section but the commit missed one usage
of the old quota_driver option, and the remaining usage causes
the following warning warning to appear repeatedly.

Config option None.quota_driver is deprecated.
Use option quota.driver instead.

This replaces the remaining usage to get rid of that warning.

Related-Bug: #1934025
Closes-Bug: #1983125
Change-Id: Ie49dbe4633a34d1832f0dedb658d83ec74d351df

@Nikhil I think this is a better alternative to this: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148574/. That would mean we have to revert that patch.

The reason that is better is that we no longer require a buffer, meaning that the glance-api would not have to hold data in memory allowing one api to deal with more requests.

I think Stuart actually had some metrics at some time about how this speeds up the api and makes it more resilient.'}, {'account_id': 17116, 'date': '2016-07-01 14:28:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Oh and its not a WIP.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-06-30 05:58:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Looks like Stuart isn't around any more. Someone else may need to pick up this patch."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-07-13 16:41:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

This appears to have been fixed in Glance via https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148574/ -- two years ago.  Can we abandon?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-08 07:01:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Niall, you indicated you thought this was a better solution than the referenced patch. Do you want to pick this up and continue with it? If not, do you agree this should be abandoned?'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2022-08-04 16:52:31.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

1) No activity in 4 years 2) Seems already fixed with https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance/+/148574/ 3) Copy-from is not a thing in v2. I'll abandon this, feel free to reopen if you think this patch is still needed."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-08 12:34:07.000000000', 'message': "Copy-from fix: Add 'read' to ResponseIndexable

Alternative fix for bug 1412802 ('copy-from broken for large files
and swift').

wsgi requires a generator when streaming data, eg when performing an
image download. ChunkReader requires a working 'read' function when
inputting data destined for Swift 'segments' of size less than or equal to
'swift_store_large_object_chunk_size'.

The initial implementation of copy-from introduced a ResponseIndexable
class. This was required because eventlet required methods not present
in the original 'http_response_iterator' when reading in the image data.
Eventlet's greenio required 'size' and other values when reading in the
data over the network.

However a working 'read' method -- required by greenio in this
corner case -- was not added. This meant that RepsonseIndexable
only worked for uploading to swift if the image size was less than
'swift_store_large_object_size'; for larger sizes the absense of a 'read'
function would cause a stack trace.

WIP: Needs test and paperwork.

Change-Id: Icc855fba0603cb6db4c701de46f233cb4c5f4e6b
"}, {'created': '2015-10-28 15:18:02.000000000', 'message': "Copy-from fix: Add 'read' to ResponseIndexable

"}, {'created': '2015-10-29 13:18:46.000000000', 'message': "Copy-from fix: Add 'read' to ResponseIndexable

Alternative fix for bug 1412802 ('copy-from broken for large files
and swift').

wsgi requires a generator when streaming data, eg when performing an
image download. ChunkReader requires a working 'read' function when
inputting data destined for Swift 'segments' of size less than or equal to
'swift_store_large_object_chunk_size'.

The initial implementation of copy-from introduced a ResponseIndexable
class. This was required because eventlet required methods not present
in the original 'http_response_iterator' when reading in the image data.
Eventlet's greenio required 'size' and other values when reading in the
data over the network.

However a working 'read' method -- required by greenio in this
corner case -- was not added. This meant that RepsonseIndexable
only worked for uploading to swift if the image size was less than
'swift_store_large_object_size'; for larger sizes the absense of a 'read'
function would cause a stack trace.

WIP: Needs test and paperwork.

Change-Id: Icc855fba0603cb6db4c701de46f233cb4c5f4e6b
"}, {'created': '2016-04-05 15:16:08.000000000', 'message': "Copy-from fix: Add 'read' to ResponseIndexable

Alternative fix for bug 1412802 ('copy-from broken for large files
and swift').

wsgi requires a generator when streaming data, eg when performing an
image download. ChunkReader requires a working 'read' function when
inputting data destined for Swift 'segments' of size less than or equal to
'swift_store_large_object_chunk_size'.

The initial implementation of copy-from introduced a ResponseIndexable
class. This was required because eventlet required methods not present
in the original 'http_response_iterator' when reading in the image data.
Eventlet's greenio required 'size' and other values when reading in the
data over the network.

However a working 'read' method -- required by greenio in this
corner case -- was not added. This meant that RepsonseIndexable
only worked for uploading to swift if the image size was less than
'swift_store_large_object_size'; for larger sizes the absense of a 'read'
function would cause a stack trace.

WIP: Needs test and paperwork.

Change-Id: Icc855fba0603cb6db4c701de46f233cb4c5f4e6b
"}]
commit_message:
Copy-from fix: Add 'read' to ResponseIndexable

Alternative fix for bug 1412802 ('copy-from broken for large files
and swift').

wsgi requires a generator when streaming data, eg when performing an
image download. ChunkReader requires a working 'read' function when
inputting data destined for Swift 'segments' of size less than or equal to
'swift_store_large_object_chunk_size'.

The initial implementation of copy-from introduced a ResponseIndexable
class. This was required because eventlet required methods not present
in the original 'http_response_iterator' when reading in the image data.
Eventlet's greenio required 'size' and other values when reading in the
data over the network.

However a working 'read' method -- required by greenio in this
corner case -- was not added. This meant that RepsonseIndexable
only worked for uploading to swift if the image size was less than
'swift_store_large_object_size'; for larger sizes the absense of a 'read'
function would cause a stack trace.

WIP: Needs test and paperwork.

Change-Id: Icc855fba0603cb6db4c701de46f233cb4c5f4e6b

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I74e80a0f336cd0ae890f6883df118f40085179aa

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I35e5dca33aeff98e31ddd25baecb58ccf4078890

Centos 8 stream amphora images were incorrectly using haproxy from

commit_message:
Fix centos 8 stream haproxy repository

Centos 8 stream amphora images were incorrectly using haproxy from
Centos 8 NFV network-extras repo. This repo was deleted and was replaced
by a Centos 8 stream repo.

Change-Id: I5b50ebc5e9443f1a0edd987069d482e03d85e726

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-22 20:24:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix lint.sh removal of files/symlinks

Running 'tox -e lint' in openstack-helm always results in
the removal of one symlink:

$ tox -e lint
$ git status
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add/rm <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git restore <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
	deleted:    openstack/charts/helm-toolkit

Remove the 'rm -rf */charts/helm-toolkit' that's doing it as
it doesn't seem to correct any more.

Change-Id: I0271a6687ce47a09d228a991dfe1d59c9239ba49
'}]
commit_message:
Fix lint.sh removal of files/symlinks

Running 'tox -e lint' in openstack-helm always results in
the removal of one symlink:

$ tox -e lint
$ git status
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add/rm <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git restore <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
	deleted:    openstack/charts/helm-toolkit

Remove the 'rm -rf */charts/helm-toolkit' that's doing it as
it doesn't seem to correct any more.

Change-Id: I0271a6687ce47a09d228a991dfe1d59c9239ba49

[{'created': '2022-05-27 08:38:39.000000000', 'message': 'Partially revert "Do not link up HA router gateway in backup node"

This partially reverts commit c52029c39aa824a67095fbbf9e59eff769d92587.

We revert everything except one minor addition to
neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py which ensures that ha_confs path is
created when the keepalived manager is initialised.

Closes-Bug: #1965297
Change-Id: I14ad015c4344b32f7210c924902dac4e6ad1ae88
(cherry picked from commit 36bf1df46df4de8f9ed0c19e1118480ce2e55d8a)
'}]
commit_message:
Partially revert "Do not link up HA router gateway in backup node"

This partially reverts commit c52029c39aa824a67095fbbf9e59eff769d92587.

We revert everything except one minor addition to
neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py which ensures that ha_confs path is
created when the keepalived manager is initialised.

Closes-Bug: #1965297
Change-Id: I14ad015c4344b32f7210c924902dac4e6ad1ae88
(cherry picked from commit 36bf1df46df4de8f9ed0c19e1118480ce2e55d8a)

commit_message:
[stable/train] Convert neutron-tempest-postgres-full to zuul v3

Similar to neutron-grenade, this legacy periodic job is now failing,
timeout in setup steps [0]

Switch it to tempest-integrated-networking (as was done in later
branches)

Also remove leftover playbooks from neutron-tempest-with-os-ken-master
job (removed in stable branches)

Related-Bug: #1982720

[0] https://zuul.openstack.org/builds?job_name=neutron-tempest-postgres-full&branch=stable%2Ftrain

Change-Id: I8936df335dcddff5d7f8111815e2062a42e6bf6d

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-15 11:16:12.000000000', 'message': 'Make test_wait_for_instance_event_* test time independent

I91c42af8226dc8607d86c52413924351ba0586ac introduced three test cases
that unfortunately dependent on execution time. The code under test uses
a StopWatch  to measure execution time and include that in a log that is
then assert by the test cases. This cases the test assertion of "0.00
seconds" to fail on a slow CI node.

This patch removes the dependency towards StopWatch.elapsed to stabilize
the tests.

Closes-Bug: #1978817
Change-Id: Id1ba3a886cf2d31956fc8f51dc7de08a79b22922
'}]
commit_message:
Make test_wait_for_instance_event_* test time independent

I91c42af8226dc8607d86c52413924351ba0586ac introduced three test cases
that unfortunately dependent on execution time. The code under test uses
a StopWatch  to measure execution time and include that in a log that is
then assert by the test cases. This cases the test assertion of "0.00
seconds" to fail on a slow CI node.

This patch removes the dependency towards StopWatch.elapsed to stabilize
the tests.

Closes-Bug: #1978817
Change-Id: Id1ba3a886cf2d31956fc8f51dc7de08a79b22922

commit_message:
For evacuation, ignore if task_state is not None

ignore instance task state and continue with vm evacutaion

Closes-Bug: #1978983
Change-Id: I5540df6c7497956219c06cff6f15b51c2c8bc29d

Sorry I did terrible date math'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-05-24 06:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It certainly *looks* like a feature to me.   I'm a little tempted to say "it's small and only impacts one hardware driver" .. that is a slippery slope.  How few lines counts as small?

I don't like that is replies on code that was reverted even though the part this change needs is small.
The correct process would be to backport *that* patch under this one, that would give us a better idea of the impact.

From a policy POV I'm going to apply a -1, however if the ironic team feels there is value here then I'll be okay'ish with it merging'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-06-12 13:58:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Taking into account what Tony's opinion, and the fact that the boot_mode requirement is documented [1], I think this really is a feature, and thus should not be backported.

As a side note about ironic-inspector compatibility: while it would be perfect, it has never been the case and unlikely to ever become the case. They're just too different, and ironic-inspector has made some choices that are not in sync with how OOB behaves.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/advanced.html#boot-mode-support"}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2019-10-02 23:20:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2019-10-03 02:41:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Set boot_mode in node properties during OOB Introspection

During OOB Introspection, it adds boot mode as capability
in node properties so that after preparation of overcloud
nodes it will show which node has uefi or bios boot mode
properties respectively.

Change-Id: Iad8060fa13e37a2fa78d998c56d132b11ff948cf
Story: 2005119
(cherry picked from commit a79b150ea7ef305a095b7a22f3a46a7b84a98c4a)

Stop documenting netboot and the boot_option capability

Both will be removed soon. The documentation change is separated
to reduce the size of the final patch.

Change-Id: If4b9b0d095500101ca71a453d71ad95252dd8c0c

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5bd103546a0553dc6f2c5eeb6ea42f3ffa05baf5
'}, {'created': '2022-07-18 11:27:18.000000000', 'message': 'DNM testing potention Bandit job

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5bd103546a0553dc6f2c5eeb6ea42f3ffa05baf5
'}, {'created': '2022-08-04 13:19:03.000000000', 'message': 'Introducing banding job into Zed release template

Bandit[0] is a security oriented linter, seaching for common
code style issues compromising integrity of the code.

Behavior of the job would be determined by settings files within
individual repos. Allowing for projects to set strictness and other aspects based
on their needs.

commit_message:
Introducing bandit job into Zed release template

Bandit[0] is a security oriented linter, seaching for common
code style issues compromising integrity of the code.

Behavior of the job would be determined by settings files within
individual repos. Allowing for projects to set strictness and other aspects based
on their needs.

[0] https://pypi.org/project/bandit/

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5bd103546a0553dc6f2c5eeb6ea42f3ffa05baf5

[{'created': '2022-07-28 14:09:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix Redfish RAID for non-immediate controllers

Fixes ``redfish`` RAID interface workflow to not create more than 1
logical disks per controller at the same time when controller does not
support 'Immediate' application time and system needs rebooting.

With this fix virtual disks are grouped by controller and executed
in batches when reboot is required.

This enables ``redfish`` RAID interface to be used with iDRAC systems
directly as although there are many controllers that support 'Immediate'
application time, they do it only when system has completed loading.
System intermittently completes loading after IPA starts executing
clean or deploy steps rendering controllers not supporting 'Immediate'
apply time and requiring reboot. This fix handles such scenario
instead of failing to create more than 1 virtual disk.

Story: 2009863
Task: 44529

Conflicts:
       ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/raid.py
        ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/redfish/test_raid.py

(cherry picked from commit d7d8f8754b36af4b686ce540e699fc5cb945c10c)

commit_message:
Fix Redfish RAID for non-immediate controllers

Fixes ``redfish`` RAID interface workflow to not create more than 1
logical disks per controller at the same time when controller does not
support 'Immediate' application time and system needs rebooting.

With this fix virtual disks are grouped by controller and executed
in batches when reboot is required.

This enables ``redfish`` RAID interface to be used with iDRAC systems
directly as although there are many controllers that support 'Immediate'
application time, they do it only when system has completed loading.
System intermittently completes loading after IPA starts executing
clean or deploy steps rendering controllers not supporting 'Immediate'
apply time and requiring reboot. This fix handles such scenario
instead of failing to create more than 1 virtual disk.

Story: 2009863
Task: 44529

 Conflicts:
       ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/raid.py

Change-Id: Ia2ce34f09695731b0f48798f662006c4904e2223
(cherry picked from commit d7d8f8754b36af4b686ce540e699fc5cb945c10c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-31 14:29:30.000000000', 'message': '(WIP) NetApp ONTAP: Migration from ZAPI to REST API

Previously, all the requests from the driver to the ONTAP backend
were made using ZAPI calls. This patch provides a new implementation
of these requests, using the new REST API provided by ONTAP.

Note: the ZAPI support was not removed due to compatibility reasons.

The functions implemented, along with their unit tests, are related
to the following driver features:
  - Periodic tasks
    > Update SSC (Storage Service Catalog)
    > Handle housekeeping (ensure snapmirrors, delete unused artifacts)
  - Create Volume
  - Delete Volume
  - Attach Volume
  - Detach Volume

Co-authored-by: Fábio Oliveira <fabioaurelio1269@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Fernando Ferraz <sfernand@netapp.com>
Co-authored-by: Luisa Amaral <luisaa@netapp.com>
Co-authored-by: Vinícius Angiolucci Reis <angiolucci@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ibdd86ee08385c15ab1d9a0386ed2e83f0d76d27d
'}]
commit_message:
(WIP) NetApp ONTAP: Migration from ZAPI to REST API

Previously, all the requests from the driver to the ONTAP backend
were made using ZAPI calls. This patch provides a new implementation
of these requests, using the new REST API provided by ONTAP.

Note: the ZAPI support was not removed due to compatibility reasons.

The functions implemented, along with their unit tests, are related
to the following driver features:
  - Periodic tasks
    > Update SSC (Storage Service Catalog)
    > Handle housekeeping (ensure snapmirrors, delete unused artifacts)
  - Create Volume
  - Delete Volume
  - Attach Volume
  - Detach Volume

Co-authored-by: Fábio Oliveira <fabioaurelio1269@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Fernando Ferraz <sfernand@netapp.com>
Co-authored-by: Luisa Amaral <luisaa@netapp.com>
Co-authored-by: Vinícius Angiolucci Reis <angiolucci@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ibdd86ee08385c15ab1d9a0386ed2e83f0d76d27d

commit_message:
Remove "distutils" library

Library "distutils" will be marked as deprecated in Python 3.10:
https://peps.python.org/pep-0386/

This patch does the following replacements, that provide the same
functionality and API:
- distutils.version.StrictVersion -> versionutils.
convert_version_to_tuple
- distutils.spawn.find_executable -> shutil.which

Change-Id: I99f862e021fe8a93c3514010ebfa690f09ee54fd
Closes-Bug: #1973780

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-29 14:05:14.000000000', 'message': "Port update will trigger less notifications to the DHCP agents

After port update, DHCP agent will be notified about changes only if
one of the port's attributes related somehow to the DHCP will change.
Such fields are:
* fixed_ips,
* MAC address,
* dns_domain,
* dns_name,
* dns_assignment,
* extra_dhcp_opts.

In other cases there is no reason to send notifications to the agent.
This will results with less notifications to the DHCP agent and less
possibilities to race condition between DHCP and L2 agents while
switching ports from the DOWN to ACTIVE status and sending notifications
to nova.

Conflicts:
    neutron/api/rpc/agentnotifiers/dhcp_rpc_agent_api.py

Closes-Bug: #1982367
Change-Id: If7990bdec435af76ad2e88fd4ea2bc24a255fd5a
(cherry picked from commit 06ddcaf4368ce054a8d396e70880f7dd1abe0562)
(cherry picked from commit 14ff8dca34f185eca1ffb50da7e81d7e6eccc3d8)
"}]
commit_message:
Port update will trigger less notifications to the DHCP agents

After port update, DHCP agent will be notified about changes only if
one of the port's attributes related somehow to the DHCP will change.
Such fields are:
* fixed_ips,
* MAC address,
* dns_domain,
* dns_name,
* dns_assignment,
* extra_dhcp_opts.

In other cases there is no reason to send notifications to the agent.
This will results with less notifications to the DHCP agent and less
possibilities to race condition between DHCP and L2 agents while
switching ports from the DOWN to ACTIVE status and sending notifications
to nova.

Conflicts:
    neutron/api/rpc/agentnotifiers/dhcp_rpc_agent_api.py

Closes-Bug: #1982367
Change-Id: If7990bdec435af76ad2e88fd4ea2bc24a255fd5a
(cherry picked from commit 06ddcaf4368ce054a8d396e70880f7dd1abe0562)
(cherry picked from commit 14ff8dca34f185eca1ffb50da7e81d7e6eccc3d8)

subject: Pass br-bmaas or internal container interface IP to os_ironic role
messages: [{'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2022-08-04 09:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2022-08-04 12:06:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nThis can be done entirely in the os_ironic role, abandoning'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-08-04 09:18:16.000000000', 'message': 'Pass br-bmaas or internal container interface IP to os_ironic role

The ironic role needs to know the IP address that it has on the
bmaas network. This might be from a bridge on the host or be
and interface inside an LXC container, dynamic-address-fact.yml
can determine this from the container_networks information.

The ironic role does not work correctly in LXC deployments
without this change as the PXE and http services bind to
ansible_host on the mgmt network, rather than the bmaas network.

Change-Id: Ie80e667c43fa3588f8c594dcb41aeea1aa6fd1b0
'}]
commit_message:
Pass br-bmaas or internal container interface IP to os_ironic role

The ironic role needs to know the IP address that it has on the
bmaas network. This might be from a bridge on the host or be
and interface inside an LXC container, dynamic-address-fact.yml
can determine this from the container_networks information.

The ironic role does not work correctly in LXC deployments
without this change as the PXE and http services bind to
ansible_host on the mgmt network, rather than the bmaas network.

Change-Id: Ie80e667c43fa3588f8c594dcb41aeea1aa6fd1b0

commit_message:
linter: add name to blocks

A later version of ansible-lint enforces names on blocks.  This is
generally a good rule; fix a few missing blocks here.

Change-Id: Ia87a0c21ec0ed1662e37cbc9e17a0df344b54e57

host entries for cell controller VIP(s) in mult-cell
environments:

- 16.2: I47b95ad46e2d4e5b1f370a2f840826e87da2d703 no longer
  uses compute hosts for cell_v2 discovery. In that case, having
  /etc/hosts entries for the Cell(s) controllers DB VIP(s) added

- 16.1 (is in maintainance mode): it misses that backport for

Address that requirement by making sure the task
add_internalapi_hosts_entries.yml is executed for Controllers and also
Computes.

commit_message:
[Train-only] Add cell(s) controllers VIPs for computes /etc/hosts

In layered OSP products based on Train, we use two methods of adding
host entries for cell controller VIP(s) in mult-cell
environments:

- 16.2: I47b95ad46e2d4e5b1f370a2f840826e87da2d703 no longer
  uses compute hosts for cell_v2 discovery. In that case, having
  /etc/hosts entries for the Cell(s) controllers DB VIP(s) added
  only for Central controllers is sufficient.
- 16.1 (is in maintainance mode): it misses that backport for
  I47b95ad46e2d4e5b1f370a2f840826e87da2d703. And for that case,
  also compute hosts need those /etc/hosts entries added
  for each cellX controller database VIP to run cells v2 discovery
  from compute hostsm, omitting controllers off the cells scaling loop.

Address that requirement by making sure the task
add_internalapi_hosts_entries.yml is executed for Controllers and also
Computes.

Related: rhbz#2112371
Change-Id: I38e91b68bdd53b08fa59892a81a1d9a02f8ad816
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

fix: fix the action collection of zun container

1. Put the status operations in one collection
2. Add danger style to force delete

Change-Id: Ic0d18fe0e5b2148b78e1c7d24e1948160d1c43c5

Fujitsu Driver: Add volume migration support

Added support for volume migration in the Fujitsu driver.

Added below function:
update_migrated_volume
